communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request the total course completions for the Tennessee Driver Education Course (current list of providers: https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/safety/documents/Court_Ordered_Traffic_Schools.pdf), broken down by provider and year, if available, for the years 2011 through 2022

I would greatly appreciate any assistance you can provide in this matter.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with David Irons.

title: Detroit Water and Sewerage Department Autopay Issues (City of Detroit)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A document showing how many Detroit Water and Sewerage Department (DWSD) customers are signed up for autopay.
2. A document showing the number and/or percentage of DWSD autopay customers that have an overdue balance of more than $100
3. A document showing the number and/or percentage of non-autopay DWSD customers that have an overdue balance of more than $100.
4. A document showing the number and/or percentage of DWSD autopay customers who had their water shut off this year (2024) or fiscal year 2024, so far.
5. A document showing the number and/or percentage of non-autopay DWSD customers who've had their water shut off this year (2024) or fiscal year 2024, so far.

For background, I sent a similar request to DWSD Public Affairs Director Bryan Peckinpaugh on Nov. 4, 2024. This was his response:

"Thank you for giving us the opportunity to respond. Given that some of your questions are data-related, I wanted to make sure you know which items need to be requested through FOIA. All the other responses we will have to you by Thursday.

4. How many customers does DWSD have?  230,000 customers, most of which are residential (approx. 30,000 business and nonprofit customers).

4A. How many DWSD customers are signed up for autopay?  Please request this via FOIA. This information is not readily available without performing a data pull of our billing and other systems.

4B. What percentage of DWSD autopay customers have an overdue balance of more than $100?  Please request this via FOIA. This information is not readily available without performing a data pull of our billing and other systems.

4C. What percentage of non-autopay DWSD customers have an overdue balance of more than $100?  Please request this via FOIA. This information is not readily available without performing a data pull of our billing and other systems.

4D. What percentage of autopay customers had their water shut off this year?  Please request this via FOIA. This information is not readily available without performing a data pull of our billing and other systems.

4E. What percentage of non-autopay customers had their water shut off this year?  Please request this via FOIA. This information is not readily available without performing a data pull of our billing and other systems."

This information is for the general public and will not be used commercially.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Overtime Details
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any document that shows the details of overtime paid to uniform and non-uniform Detroit Police Department workers for FY 2024 through at least Nov 6, 2024 that includes the reason for overtime payments. The reasons for overtime payments may or may not include things like protests or visits by a presidential or vice presidential candidate, though they may or may not be these exact phrases.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg
